website_summaries.verdict: Monkfruit is a natural sugar, not a sugar alcohol, so it works well for both diabetics and non-diabetics on carb-restricted diets.
pros: Monkfruit and erythitrol blend for improved flavor profile
Suitable for a multitude of diet plans
Both brown and white sugar substitutes available
Derived from a variety of gourd
cons: A number of unpleasant side effects are possible
May contain much more erythitrol than actual monkfruit

customer_reviews.title: ... genuine New York Cheesecake using MONKFRUIT sweetener and I'm amazed. The taste is beyond just comparable
customer_reviews.text: I just finished making a genuine New York Cheesecake using MONKFRUIT sweetener and I'm amazed. The taste is beyond just comparable. It is indistinguishable. I will not hesitate to use this product in any of my favorite baking recipes. I only wish this was around when my mom, who suffered from Diabetes, was still alive so she could continue to enjoy all her favorite baked goods without worrying about her blood sugar. I highly recommend MONKFRUIT. It is worth every penny. My only hesitation in sharing this review is that more people will try it, buy it and then my ability to get it so quickly will be effected. So buy it, but save some for me.
customer_reviews.author: Remote Reiki and Readings

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer...put me in coach
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifestyle changer!!! I am a food addict, sugaraholic!! Started the Keto lifestyle on June 9th worried I would fail because of my love for sugar but knew I had to try...a few weeks later came across someone had made a New York style Cheesecake with this..can I say GAME CHANGER!!! I will never need to eat toxic sugar again. Welcome home Lakanton Sweeteners!!! I have 2 more in my cart ready to come home now. Oh wait did I mention cinnamon and Lakanto on my egg loaf is even better than french toast with cinnamon and sugar? My fiance couldnt tell there was no sugar in the cheesecakes. WINNER
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Delish tastes exactly like sugar.
customer_reviews.text: This has a light brown sugar taste to it and no alcohol sugar after taste. Bakes and sweetens just like sugar. Love this stuff! Takes a minute or two longer to dissolve in batters so take your time when mixing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Essentially flavorless, as claimed, but has a weird mouthfeel. Kind of tingly on the tongue, and lingering. No gas or bloating, but gross sandy diarrhea, with little or no warning. Would not buy this again, or recommend it. Especially do not recommend trying to bake with it; didn't work at all for baking.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: ... only brand of monk sugar I’ve tried and don’t like it because it doesn’t dissolve
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand of monk sugar I’ve tried and don’t like it because it doesn’t dissolve. It always maintains a crunchiness. I made ice cream and most of it sinks to the bottom and the rest is crunchy granules suspended through the ice cream. In cookies it stays crunchy too. It doesn’t dissolve for lemon aid or hot teas. It does give off sweetness with no after taste, yet you have to deal with sand like crunchy granules.I don’t plan to use the rest of the bag. Not a sugar substitute I plan to use again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Turley

customer_reviews.title: The best sugar substitute in life!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff!! By far the best sugar substitute out there. Tastes so yummy!! I’m on keto and I make keto desserts all the time and my non-keto family members can never tell it doesn’t have sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a scientist, but I researched monk fruit and erythritol online. This product is quite clear about being a combination. That’s because their goal was to create a sweet substance you can substitute 1:1 in your food and baking. I love this stuff and am absolutely thrilled to find a sugar alternative that is not harmful (eg aspartame) and helps me handle my diabetes. It even works great in baking! We just made an apple pie with crumble topping that tastes and looks “normal.” No weird aftertaste like stevia. Highly recommended! PS this product is sweeter than sugar - I use less than 1:1 substitution.
customer_reviews.author: BookMD

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS ERYTHRITOL WITH A TINY BIT OF MONK FRUIT
customer_reviews.text: If you, like me, have SEVERE, CATASTROPHIC, UNCONTROLABLE DIARRHEA when you ingest erythritol - do NOT eat this product. While monk fruit is our GI gentle friend, this product is like digesting broken glass. Trust ingredients lists over labels. Labels are nothing more than advertising.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: The best substitute sweetener!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the sugar substitutes I have tried since starting the Keto lifestyle, this one is the best. Stevia tastes bitter to me so I don't like any of the erythritol based sweeteners that add Stevia. I stay away from all sugar alcohols that can cause stomach discomfort. Swerve is good, but extremely expensive and has a distinct aftertaste. Plain erythritol is cheaper than Lakanto, but also has more of a cooling effect than this. In the end, I'm willing to pay a slight premium for Lakant rather than erythritol because it's the best.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: LIES!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: *****LIES!!!!!!*****. Warning: this will send you to the porcelain throne just like Swerve because it IS swerve. It’s erythritol with monk fruit extract. You aren’t getting a monk fruit sweetener, you’re getting erythritol that has been dolled up with it. Read the label carefully; you will find no differences between this and Swerve as far as sugar alcohol grams. The only thing this is good for: feeding to your enemies and watching them waddle to the John with pinched cheeks. Maybe a tastier alternative to a typical cleanse diet, but you may miss some work if you can’t work from the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: DecoFan

customer_reviews.title: Nice surprise. Sweet taste
customer_reviews.text: Nice surprise. Sweet taste, no after taste. No glycemic rise or pain as the result of sugar induced inflammation.
customer_reviews.author: elora

customer_reviews.title: ... product contains a tiny bit of monkfruit and a good bit of erythritol
customer_reviews.text: Since this product contains a tiny bit of monkfruit and a good bit of erythritol, and is insanely expensive, my question is: who needs it? Why not just buy erythritol, at a small fraction of the price? Erythritol tastes great. No aftertaste. IMO, the most acceptable alternative sweetener.
customer_reviews.author: Levana

customer_reviews.title: My guests loved the pecan pie made with this sugar substitute instead ...
customer_reviews.text: My guests loved the pecan pie made with this sugar substitute instead of the "real" brown sugar. Used this sweetener 1:1. One cup of sweetener replaced one cup of C&H brown sugar... no taste difference (thank God!). Not one complaint. Not one hint the recipe "tasted different." Perfect substitution. So many calories reduced. So many replaced Carbs! Finally, something that works. Taste good too. No "odd" taste. Yum. R Clark, Santa Monica, 1/2/18
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Good, Zero Glycemic Index
customer_reviews.text: This measures like sugar and has a good taste with no funny aftertaste. I have ordered this 3 times so far. I like it! I like that it has a zero glycemic index. My brother is diabetic and lives with us, and this doesn't mess with his numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Moonstar

customer_reviews.title: This is erythritol
customer_reviews.text: Do you want to buy erythritol? This is your product. First ingredient on the list is erythritol NOT monkfruit. Who knows how much monkfruit is actually in there. I am pissed. I have no desire to eat erythritol at all so this was a huge shocker and disappapointment to me. How can they even market this as monkfruit? Never would have purchased if I had any idea there was any erythritol in it, let alone a majority erythritol product. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie B.

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST monk fruit
customer_reviews.text: I gave this one star simply because it's ALMOST a monk fruit sweetener. The product name is misleading. The packaging says monk fruit sweetener WITH erythritol, but the ingredients list has erythritol as the primary ingredient. Doesn't that actually make this sweetener erythritol with monk fruit? Granted, I should've read the ingredients list before purchasing, but when a product is marketed as monkfruit, it should be foremost monk fruit and I shouldn't have to look for the fine print on the label! There isn't even a ratio on the package stating the percentage of monk fruit it actually contains. Unfortunately for me, this is a non-returnable item. Don't buy this if you're looking for a monk fruit sweetener.
customer_reviews.author: KKMugs

customer_reviews.title: No doubts about it...it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well to make icings for cakes, brownies or cup cakes. It is very sweet tasting so if you have been off sugar it will wow your mouth out! I mean WOW!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Dead bugs in my Golden Monkfruit Sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Golden Monkfruit Sweetener just over a month ago. I opened it today. All was well until I noticed dead reddish-brown bugs in the sweetener as I poured it into my other ingredients. I checked and cleaned out my cupboards and no other bugs we’re found anywhere except in this Monkfruit sweetener. I was aghast! This is a horrible find and I hope and expect the sellers to refund my purchase price even though it is past the refund policy return time.
customer_reviews.author: Dawni

customer_reviews.title: 1:1 Sugar Substitute, LOL!
customer_reviews.text: What a joke, I was looking for a sweetner to use on Keto, and tried this Monk Fruit/ Erythritol blend. This is not a 1:1 ratio to Sugar, more like 1/2 /1. It takes so much just to equal the sweetness of Sugar. If you were to use this to sweeten Kool-Aid for example, everyone that drank it would have Diarrhea, this is more Erythritol than it is Monk Fruit. If you are looking for a sweetner that won't spike your Insulin, or give bad Diarrhea; look elsewhere. Stevia is nice, if you can get over the aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT MONKFRUIT- WILL CAUSE GI DISTRESS
customer_reviews.text: I am disgusted that this product is even called "monkfruit." THIS IS NOT MONKFRUIT. This is erythritol. Artificial sweeteners cause me major GI distress and pain. Amazon recommended this product to go along with my other natural/gluten free purchases, so I assumed it would be safe. I''ll admit that I should have checked the labels more vigilantly, to check for TRUTH, because this is not safe. I used 1 tsp. and my whole day was ruined with stomach cramps/pain and a headache. Shame on you for naming this product "Monkfruit."
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Sims

customer_reviews.title: IBS/Chrons/UC stay away from this product!
customer_reviews.text: This product contains high amounts of erythritol and very little Monk Fruit. It is very overpriced. Erythritol will give you severe bloating (gas) and diarrhea — if you have digestive issues, stay away from this product. You’ll regret it. It is NOT returnable whatsoever and there are no refunds if you end up on the toilet for days because of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: important to note
customer_reviews.text: this sugar replacement tastes exactly like sugar up to a point. if you use too much then you can tell the difference. this blend is a little less sweet than sugar and not a 1:1 substitute as the packaging says. more like 3 monkfruit = 2 sugar. what's most important to note though is that this blend is almost entirely ethyritol with "monkfruit" used as a buzzword. if you buy this and like it, buy ethyritol (sugar alcohol). lakanto charges an arm and a leg for buzz words. you're paying for buzz words, but probably wouldn't be disappointed with the product: just know you've got much cheaper options if you like this.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Lakanto is entry level for me after trying other brands with better taste, quantity
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price...Lakanto is entry level for me after trying other brands with better taste, quantity, and quality value... what Lakanto is great at is deceptive marketing. Sorry guys, just dont like seeing people get taken advantage of.
customer_reviews.author: calmosphere

customer_reviews.title: Use care diverticulitis sufferers
customer_reviews.text: I have diverticulitis and I believe the erythritol in this product caused irritation that led to an infection.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Great product, However
customer_reviews.text: Great product, However, why would anyone ship this together with items that can tear the bag apart.Bag came broken and everything was out. Disgusting.Rather than enjoying 3 pounds of product I spend 3 hours cleaning the kitchen ,since entire content was spread around the shipping box sipping all around as I was trying to clean other items in the box. Shame
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Mostly erythritol with maybe a little monk fruit.
customer_reviews.text: This product is intentionally misleading. I thought it was Monk fruit sweetener. Main ingredient is erythritol... And yet on front of the package it is very small and hard to see. Would not have purchased had I known that fact. I made some almond flour brownies with this sweetener... They were WAY too sweet. It is not 1:1 with sugar as advertised. Ive made this recipe with real sugar before and they were delicious.... This time I couldn't finish a single brownie because of how sweet they were and the erythritol started hurting my stomach almost immediately. Make sure you like erythritol before you buy this. I do not.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Had severe pain in my intestinal tract after eating it
customer_reviews.text: This product sounded great. However, after trying it I began to have severe pains in my digestive tract, which lasted 24 hours. The worst was the upper right quadrant, around my liver (I'm an RN). I'm sure the problem is the erythritol that is added to the monkfruit. It took 24 hours for the pain to stop. At first I didn't know what it was, so each day I had a tiny bit (teaspoon or two), and so the pain persisted until I realized what it was.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the side effects
customer_reviews.text: This product made me sick. Check out side effects. The first tsp in my coffee made me quesy but i did not attribute this at first 2 the monk fruit.That night i had 2 tsp on blue berries. About 11pm last night i woke up throwing up with other things. It is 6 pm the next day. I am still sick going 2 urgent care. be careful with this product. I am sure the side effects r rare but i had to let people know. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Not monk fruit!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very bad reaction to this, hives, dizziness, light headedness, weakness, that went on for weeks because I didnt know the source. Then I looked at the ingredients, erythritol!! I missed work and all kinds of things I needed to do that came to a screeching halt because I didn't understand I had a reaction to erythritol, and never heard of it. I bought 2 bags I'll never use. Buy in small quantities to test in case you are sensitive like me. It took about a week to leave my system too. Be careful!!
customer_reviews.author: Andromeda

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is explosive
customer_reviews.text: Agree with other reviewers. This will put you in the bathroom without too much warning! Used it to make chocolate chip cookies and you can definitely taste the after taste. It’s bareable and I would be willing to deal with it but what follow after is not good. It will have you running to the bathroom so make sure you have one close by!
customer_reviews.author: Studiovette

customer_reviews.title: Taste great, but grainy in baked goods
customer_reviews.text: This tastes great and in line with other erythritol based sweeteners, but under performs when baking. We have used other products and figured out to grind erythritol to prevent the graininess. We did that with this and prior to baking (cheesecake) or putting in fridge to cool (custard) the recipes were smooth. After cooling overnight, the custard was grainy and you could actually see lumps of the sweetener that re-crystallized. The cheesecake tasted good, but was like eating a spoon of dried product. Like this, but disappointed in the baking properties.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G

customer_reviews.title: Makes me SO sick and Amazon won't let me return it
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness...I used to use this item religiously with a keto diet. I am now on weight watchers and wanted a 0pt option for sugar that wasn't artificial. I know this is TMI, but after using 3T in a cup of tea I am SO SICK within 30 minutes RUSHING to the bathroom. It is awful!! The rushing to the bathroom lasts all day or all night depending on when I've tried it. I thought it was a fluke and I tried it again and the same thing happened. IDK what's different about this now, but I can't even use this and it wasn't cheap!
customer_reviews.author: PrivateUser

customer_reviews.title: How much monk fruit could there be in this?
customer_reviews.text: I'm no scientist but if monk fruit is 300x sweeter then sugar and this is 1:1 to sugar then how much monk fruit is really in this? I use it for my coffee and I do need to put a teaspoon of this in to get it to equal the sweetness of sugar, so they are telling the truth about the ratio.
customer_reviews.author: aml

customer_reviews.title: Sweetned with Erythritol!!
customer_reviews.text: I read lots of reviews before purchasing this because I don't like artificial sweeteners! I should have read the ingredient list because it didn't specify had erythritol in it. One review specifically made reference to it not including alcohol sugars so I guess the reviews are also for other products? Either way I have wasted $23 bucks because we can't use this and it's not returnable!!
customer_reviews.author: Blwaters2016

customer_reviews.title: BEST SUGAR ALTERNATIVE.... EVER!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING!! I have tried every alternative sweetener out there..... Splenda, agave, stevia, etc.....and have disliked ALL of them. This is TRULY the first alternative to sugar that ACTUALLY TASTES LIKE SUGAR!!! Even in my coffee!! This baking sweetener acts JUST like sugar in baked goods, even more than the original granulated did, and that one was pretty good!! I made a batch of the above pictured Skinny Chocolate Muffins, (recipe from Pounddropper.com) that tastes ANYTHING but Skinny!!! They were sweet and chocolatey, but more importantly, had the tender crumb of a muffin made with sugar!! It's wonderful to FINALLY find a product that lets me enjoy sweets while sticking to my weight loss plan!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Caivano

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY ....4GRAMS OF SUGAR ALCOHOL
customer_reviews.text: Not pure monk fruit and no percentage of added erythritol mentioned so it could be 90% eryth to 10% monk ,nobody know and all of this is hidden behind a sticker that you cant take off
customer_reviews.author: yacoub s nasrallah

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money or time!!
customer_reviews.text: I am recovering from gastric surgery and am restricted to usung sugar substitutes. I was so hungry for blueberry muffins, and when I found this sweetener I was so excited. Unfortunately my excitement didn’t last long. The sweetness in the muffins was nonexistent. In fact the after taste wa very very unpleasant. To add insult to injury, the contents measured out to be little over a cup. I can buy premade muffins cheaper and more delectable. I’m going back to Splenda. It’s less expensive and couldn’t possibly taste any worse.
customer_reviews.author: BettyLou

customer_reviews.title: WARNING DO NOT BUY-DECEPTIVE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This item monkfruit is advertised as zero carbohydrates and can be used by diabetic. This is a lie....DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT IF YOU ARE DIABETIC OR KETONE SENSITIVE!!!!!!! This product is a natural sugar and erythritol, a sugar alcohol, has been added. Listing this as zero carbs and then adding sugar which is what carbs turn to is deceptive and can be injurous if you are diabetic, counter productive if you are on a keto diet or you are ketone sensitive. DO NOT BUY - they will not allow you to return if you discover this after purchase so you will be out of money and out of a product you can not use.
customer_reviews.author: Noble El

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why but this stuff is no bueno
customer_reviews.text: Saw all the great reviews and decided to give this a try. Not sure if it's something with my taste and smell but upon opening the bag this "sugar" substitute smelled awful. Not even sure how to describe it. Chemical like. Nothing I've ever smelled before. Decided to give it a chance..maybe the tastes was better...nope it tasted like it smelled. Also the ratio is in no way 1:1 to sugar. Sad because really was looking forward to this. Guess I'll keep searching.
customer_reviews.author: Damon.D

customer_reviews.title: Variable response
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this product. I bought it and made something with it right away. My husband said it tasted just like "regular" sugar to him. To me it tasted terrible: chemical like, an odd cooling sensation, then I could feel a burning all down my throat. I felt ill all night after only eating two bites. I think perhaps most people can enjoy this but those who might be sensitive to sugar alcohols, not so much. Maybe try someone else's before purchasing an entire, expensive bag.
customer_reviews.author: scout

customer_reviews.title: Read the warning
customer_reviews.text: So it says that some people are sensitive to this stuff and it may cause some GI issues like diarrhea, boy were they NOT KIDDING. ever eat chocolate pudding then sneeze at a toilet? I had ONE cup of coffee with this stuff in it, and an hour later it started. It's been 4 hours now and I've lost 6 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all for baking or making jam
customer_reviews.text: I tried making strawberry jam with Lakanto Monkfruit sugar and I ended up wasting 2 cups of this VERY expensive sugar! I've made jam hundreds of times (with regular sugar) and never had a problem. This jam ended up crystallizing to the point where it was inedible. I had to throw both jars of jam out. Complete waste of money! I even tried making carrot cake with it and had to throw the cake out because it was seriously lacking in sweetness, it tasted awful (and yes, I've made this recipe before with regular sugar). So now I'm stuck with the leftover 1/2 bag or so which I'll use for my morning coffee. Never buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mya LouLou

customer_reviews.title: Helped me lose 40 pounds
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is my go to for sweetner. I have been on the keto diet and have lost 40 pounds thanks to monkfruit. I was recently diagnosed again with non hodgkins lymphoma again. I have fallen off my keto diet a little bit. Still maintaining my wieght loss. But i must get back on as cancer feeds off sugar. So it's time to buy another bag of monkfruit. The only downfall is the price. It is quite a bit pricier than sugar. But it really works. I guarantee if you watch your carb intake and replace regular sugar with monkfruit you will be success with your wieght loss.
customer_reviews.author: heather evans

customer_reviews.title: No aftertaste, not as sweet as sugar, and horrible bag
customer_reviews.text: I hate stevia and it's weird aftertaste, it completely ruins coffee for me. This has no aftertaste but I think they went cheap/too far cutting it with erythritol, you probably need 25% more of this to get the same sweetness as sugar. They say it's a 1-1 replacement in recipes for sugar and it's not. The bag it comes in has a ridiculous seal that you have to break your fingers to mash it closed completely. I spilled a bunch because I thought it was closed but it wasn't. Overall I would buy again because it's 0 calories and has the right taste, but it sure is a pricey substitute.
customer_reviews.author: heyhey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice flour
customer_reviews.text: So I had weight loss surgery 4 years ago, so I do not eat regular flour, etc. because I am on the Bariatric Keto diet. I decided I NEEDED some bread recently and found some recipes for almond flour (And currently doing the Bariatric Keto Restart plan). Some of the recipes called for a sweetener, so I decided with the advice of a friend, to try this one. I have had issues in the past with some sweeteners, but thankfully this one was not too strong, nor did it have the bitter after taste I have found with other ones. I ordered the classic flavor and it worked well with my recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't taste much different from Halefresh Erythratol
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't taste much different from Halefresh erythritol and costs quite a bit more. I don't think that either is very good as a sweetener. it takes spoons and spoons to even taste remotely sweet, just like other sugar substitutes, but at least doesn't seem to have a terrible after taste that comes with some other types. Overall I think it's not a good enough substitute for sugar to even bother at all. If you're going buy it either way choose the cost effective option and go with pure erythritol instead of pretending the trace of monk fruit somehow makes it better.
customer_reviews.author: S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT BAKE LIKE SUGAR!!
customer_reviews.text: I love to bake, but I also have PCOS so I try to make "skinny" versions of certain things so I can enjoy them. I tried this out on a few different things, but overall I have to say it does NOT bake like sugar. For example, I made snickerdoodles that came out alright and tasted ok immediately out of the oven, but after they cooled the sugar alcohols just clumped together and tasted awful. Comes to show that you just can't replace sugar. I recommend using agave, raw brown sugar or honey instead of white refined because this stuff is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Anna G.

customer_reviews.title: you'll be disappointed. The first ingredient is erythritol
customer_reviews.text: If you're purchasing this product expecting it to be pure monkfruit, you'll be disappointed. The first ingredient is erythritol. I feel that being a 1:1 replacement for sugar, this gets a tad expensive in baking. It does, however, have MUCH less of a cooling effect than say, Pyure (which is the only other alternative sweetener baking blend I've tried). All in all, good flavor - and my coworker experienced much less 'gastric distress' trying baked goods with this, as opposed to other erythritol heavy sweeteners. I would purchase again if I don't find an alternative I like better - but for the size of the bag, the price, and the amount of baking I do, it's not budget friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey J

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, easy measurements equal with sugar
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been through numerous artificial sweeteners and found this one to be the best taste wise. It is almost a tad less sweet equal parts with sugar which is great. No awful after tastes like other brands. We love the baking version for use in all things (baking, mixed drinks like margaritas, making jams). Just bought the golden monk fruit sweetener to try in an old fashion and will update a review there with what I think as the maple flavor of that should be great!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: Great sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a couple of other types of sweeteners, stevia for one which I strongly disliked and I've tried 3 different brands. So far, this one is by far the best tasting. Still a teeny bit of aftertaste but nothing like the other 2. I used it in my coffee and made a very yummy Keto strawberries and cream treat with it. Even hubby who usually dislikes any kind of sugar replacement went on and on about how delish it was. I plan to do tons more experimenting. I'll update as I go.
customer_reviews.author: Kim HendersonTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: This does not bake like sugar at all
customer_reviews.text: This does not bake like sugar at all. I made a batch of chocolate chip cookies and even the chocolate chips didn't save the flavor. it just tasted super weird. For anyone looking for a sugar substitute without a funky taste, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: yb

customer_reviews.title: I think it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bit the bullet and sprung for the 16oz bag, as I’ve had bad experiences with artificial sweeteners, and I’m so mad I didn’t get the bigger bag! Upon opening and sampling a pinch, it’s sweeter than sugar with no bitter aftertaste. I absolutely hate Stevia for its’ bitterness and detest Equal and Sweet N Low for the same reasons. Splenda was my reluctant go-to, but it’s not going to be any longer! I found my new sugar substitute and could only be happier if it were cheaper. Get some. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: misterjc

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived opened
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived sliced open with the product spilled out in the amazon envelope. I do not have a way of knowing if the product was tampered with. When I tried to initiate a return or refund they system informed me that the product was ineligible. I cannot recommend buing this product if I have no recourse when the package arrives opened and possibly tampered with. Fyi, I tore the amazon perforation on the envelope with my bare hands and didn't use a blade.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius Hornswoggle

customer_reviews.title: I'll keep searching for something better
customer_reviews.text: The product works as it is intended. I am only disappointed by the cooling effect. I had been using Swerve(which I love, but it is expensive, and the cooling effect is ugh). I searched around for another low carb sweetener with less of a cooling effect. Reviews of this product said the effect "was that bad/noticeable". We I am here to tell you that it is very much noticeable. It is equal if not more noticeable than swerve. Of course I ordered the huge bags of classic and brown.
customer_reviews.author: squisheez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many other non sugar sweeteners trying to find one that tastes similar to real sugar so Im not tasting it in my coffee. I was using stevia before the monk fruit. When I received this package of monk fruit I immediately opened and licked my finger to try it as did my entire family. The taste is sweeter than sugar and way way better than sugar. I am super excited cause I finally found a sweetener that I can use in my coffee and not taste it afterwards. Monk fruit has zero calories for my diet and is supposed to be healthy as well. I will be ordering this from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Wildlifer

customer_reviews.title: Basically Erythritol
customer_reviews.text: I have been using erythritol for a year, which is fantastic-- except for that cooling effect you get in baked goods that can be annoying at times. I decided to give this sweetner a try, to see if it was any better. Taste wise, it's great-- but I too was surprised to see that it's mixed with erythritol. I baked a few things using this, and while the cooling effect was marginally better, you could still feel it. With the higher price of monk fruit, only to have it cut with erythritol doesn't really make it worth it in my opinion. I'll just stick to buying my generic erythritol for a lot less $$.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet34Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best Keto Friendly Sweetener I've Had
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's mostly erythatol so they're kind of false advertising what it is, but it's a great sweetener. From what I've seen, Pure monk fruit is 200 times sweeter than sugar and is really expensive. But I think this is the closest I'm gonna get to sugar on keto. It doesn't have any off flavors like Stevia or cooling after taste like regular erythatol does. In my opinion is not quite as sweet as sugar but it's close, so just adjust to taste.
customer_reviews.author: Braden

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great but bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is great but the package arrived with a cut in it and was all over the box and the other electronics. It even got in the bags inside the other boxes. When I lifted the box off of the bed there was a pile there too. Maybe they shouldn't package soft bags with sharp edged boxes. This stuff is everywhere and I hope my little dog doesn't get a hold of it, not to mention all the expensive product I lost that can't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: skymom

customer_reviews.title: Good but Not
customer_reviews.text: Confused by all the good reviews. I have tried many different recipes with many different ingredients using this. The taste is good but when I use this to make cookies, brownies, or anything of that consistency they all come out like rock hard hockey pucks. The only thing so far that actually comes out normal is when I put it in any kind of milk product like heavy whipping cream, cream cheese or a coconut cream.
customer_reviews.author: skyjy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tasting monk fruit sweetener
customer_reviews.text: So I'm trying to give up on sugar in my daily food/drink intake. I used monk fruit sweetener because it doesn't affect the blood glucose levels like the other artificial sweetener. I've tried many different brands and Lakanto is the best. It doesn't leave a weird aftertaste like the other brands. To my taste buds, it tastes exactly like sugar. I've also used it for baking and it turned out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous, healthy sugar replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a low carb protocol for four months now and using Lakanto Monk fruit has been a true lifesaver! I have the classic granular and the confectioners sugar and they both are amazingly delicious. They blend well, mix well, etc. No weird aftertaste like Stevia and no harmful side effects like aspartame! If you have children I highly doubt they would notice the difference. There is one that is a blend that has chicory root that I personally did not like. I have a sensitivity to chicory root and it to trigger a mild headache. I also have ordered the Lakanto chocolate chips - amazing and better than regular chocolate chips!
customer_reviews.author: RuthAnne

customer_reviews.title: Not a good substitution for Swerve
customer_reviews.text: I love Swerve and I thought I'd try this cause it was a bit cheaper. I regret it. It says it doesn't have an aftertaste but it does. A distinct one that I can't forgive in my morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Would be great stuff, but is only about 1/2 the sweetness of regular sugar
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is expensive, which I didn't mind too much as long as it was worth it. However, it is only 1/2 as sweet as regular sugar. I thought maybe it was just me, but gave some to a couple friends to try and they complained of the same issue. It's too bad, because it could have been a great product. At half the strength of sugar this winds up being $18.00 a lb. I would be nervous about baking with it because you can't just add twice as much substance to a dish and expect it to turn out. Hopefully someone will do a better job of this
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: Much more expensive in the store
customer_reviews.text: So much better to buy this in bulk from Amazon. I use it every day to sweeten coffee and such. They sell a little 4 to 6 oz bag for seven or 8 bucks where I live. I have even given as gifts to other members of my extended family who are prediabetic. They love it. I sometimes use it to sub out some or all of the sugar in recipes. If I don't have to share :) and I don't overdo on using in recipes and just use mostly for general sweetening of beverages and smoothies, this bag lasts 4 to 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

customer_reviews.title: It turns sour when cooked
customer_reviews.text: I got this product last week. I used one cup of it to bake a cake. After cooked the cake was sour and had a weird taste. It was not edible and I had to throw the whole cake out. To be sure, I put two spoons of it in a glass of water and put it in the microwave for 1.5 minutes just to be sure that the sour taste was caused by the sugar. It turned sour again and thee water tasted so bad! The uncooked sugar tastes really well but I don't think it's suited for baking.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this Monk Fruit blend.
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a sweat toothed woman, but it is lovely to HAVE a sweet option on occasion. I'm gluten free and eat a low carb diet consisting mostly of fresh (and frozen) veggies, lean meats and limited fruits. This blend is the best one I have tried (and there have been several). It tastes "cool" to the tongue, but there is no bitter aftertaste (like stevia). I do not get "bathroom" issues from it, and it comes in white, golden and powdered formulations.
customer_reviews.author: GramBBB

customer_reviews.title: fasters that hate black coffee and plain tea rejoice!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what sort of witchcraft created this, but it is amazing. Tastes exactly like sugar and won't spike your blood sugar or create any sort of insulin response? Count me in!!! Now you might be saying "but it has 4 carbs, there will be an insulin response and it will take you out of your fast." I thought the same thing. But those carbs are from the erythritol, which is a sugar alcohol. Most sugar alcohols warrant a sugar and insulin response, erythritol does not. So you are good to put it in your coffee or tea or whatever your zero calorie drink of choice is and stay in your fat burning, fasted state!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler D

customer_reviews.title: Came with a hole in the bag and weighed in a lot less than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product came with a hole in the bag and weighed in at 961g when it’s supposed to be 1361g. I’d like someone to contact me about a refund or replacement. I’ve previously purchased the 1lb bags with no issue and loved them. This time I went for the 3lb and my experience wasn’t as good. If someone contacts me for this issue I’d be happy to change my review because I do like the product very much but this logistical issue is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Cicero

customer_reviews.title: Best sugar substitute ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am a certified health coach and I do my best to avoid sugar. Over the years I have tried many different substitutes like stevia and sweet n low but there was always something off about them. This sweetener is by far the closest substitute to sugar that's on the market, plus it's all natural and not a sugar alcohol. It's also great that you can use it as a direct replacement for sugar in any recipe! I can't say enough positive things about this product. I will continue to purchase this from here on out and will be recommending to this to my clients.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I make an effort to avoid sugar but my coffee has always been my downfall because substitutes always have an awful aftertaste and don’t counteract the bitterness. I was using another brand of monk/erythritol blend which was good and did the trick but I decided to try this one and omg it is delicious and so much better in coffee! I changed my subscribe and save and I won’t use another one, well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Shaq

customer_reviews.title: Mostly chemicals
customer_reviews.text: This product mostly erythritol which is produced industrially by taking a molecule of corn, cleaving it into two parts by the addition of a molecule of water to generate glucose. Glucose is then fermented with yeast or another fungus to produce erythritol. It's a manufactured chemical. So if this is what you want to ingest, go ahead but just know there is not much "natural" monkfruit here. Might as well ingest any artificial sweetener. And BTW it's not returnable
customer_reviews.author: Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Not really Monk fruit
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan! Left a bad aftertaste in my mouth. It didnt work for me, it gave a low grade head for a couple hours both days i tried it. I was mostly disappointed thats its a chemical with monk fruit in it.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptical Eye

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but good
customer_reviews.text: If you are eliminating sugar, this works great as a substitute for granulated sugar. I used it in a lemon zucchini bread that I had used this same brand in powdered sugar in the glaze. I am trying to be very careful to not keep a lot of sweets around since we eliminated sugar, but sometimes there are things you have baked in the past that you still want to make again - these sugars allow you to do that without sacrificing flavor. This granulated sugar also bakes up much better than artificial sweeteners. I think the baked goods may be a bit heavier than regular sugar, but the taste is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B

customer_reviews.title: Great sugar substitute!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! You can use it 1:1 in recipes as a sugar replacement and you would never know the sugar has been substituted for something else! I've tried all the other sugar substitutes out there and honestly nothing comes as close to tasting like sugar as Monkfruit sugar! It's hard to find it in store as they either don't carry it or are sold out, but I found the big bag over Amazon and I'm thrilled as I use this for everything! What I love is this is not a powder, the texture is granulated and there is no weird after taste like a lot of other sugar substitutes!
customer_reviews.author: DoodleBug

customer_reviews.title: Great sugar substitute- coffee tastes better - great for AIP/Paleo dieters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the white sweetener- made to replace white sugar with no calories (zero glycemic index). I wanted to replace Splenda, Stevia, etc because of a transition to the autoimmune protocol / Paleo diet. Gluten-free, granularity is like sugar. No problems with clumping. I swear my coffee tastes better with this sweetener than when compared to that made with Stevia and Splendia; maybe it is the lack of an aftertaste, but I can taste the aroma of the coffee. I do find for me the replacement to Splenda to be 3 tsp of Monkfruit to 1 packet of Splenda. Haven't compared to sugar, maybe it is 1:1 as in the ad. Perfect for the AIP dieter.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: It's sweet and flavorless?
customer_reviews.text: This is an interesting product. I tasted a 1/2 teaspoon full directly and it certainly gives you that sweet sensation but it oddly has no flavor at all. It's really a difficult sensation to describe I guess, but I really don't get any noticeable flavor from this, which is actually great for a zero calorie sweetner. From my experience, there's no aftertaste either. It's definitely expensive if this is supposed to be 1:1 sugar replacement, but I don't sweeten things all that much, so it will serve my purposes. I'm just grateful that there's no chemical taste that I get from all other sweetners, even Stevia. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Beware of smelly side effects
customer_reviews.text: Is this the stuff they make sugar-free gummy bears from? The ones that taste so amazing but do bad things to you almost instantaneously? Good Lord, it makes me sad to find out this is mostly erythritol, because it tastes SO good. I should have read a little more into the product before buying, I could have saved myself the discomfort. And note, the discomfort came with only using one level teaspoon in my coffee. That's NOT consuming excessive amounts. This product I give one star for being such a tasty, beautiful lie.
customer_reviews.author: Lauralou

customer_reviews.title: I was about to go back to sugar when I found this.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried them all, and found erythritol to be the closest to a real sugar taste, but still had and aftertaste and that "cooling effect". I tried monk fruit on it's own, and didn't like it at all. Allulose made me sick. Stevia and the rest have awful aftertaste. My sister promised me that I would like this. I didn't believe her because of my experience with monk fruit. Oh my goodness, was I amazed at how the two cancel out the aftertaste of the other. Even my husband can't tell the difference between this and sugar, and he's a sugar freak.
customer_reviews.author: WA roots

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only sugar substitute I can use! The rest are cloying or have a terrible aftertaste or too fake. It isn't exactly like sugar, but pretty dang close. There's no weird taste, and no digestive upset. I bake with it and put it in my coffee. It's pretty much a 1:1 substitution for sugar. I've seen some reviews saying it's probably just erythritol, but it's not. I've used pure before, and it has a distinct cooling sensation that I didn't care for. This does not, unless you take it straight and even then only extremely vaguely. Very happy I found it! Only thing I don't love is how pricey it is.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesky12

customer_reviews.title: Sounds ridiculous, but, Lakanto Golden Monkfruit Sweetener has changed my life.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds ridiculous, but, Lakanto Golden Monkfruit Sweetener has changed my life. This is the only non-sugar sweetener that I have ever enjoyed using. I use it just like sugar, in coffee, in desserts and baking, and have not had any consistency issues. I have noticed a cooling effect with certain recipes but, all in all, this stuff is amazing. This is my go to, and I am happy to have replaced sugar completely.
customer_reviews.author: DMcKenna

customer_reviews.title: Chemical taste, made my stomach hurt
customer_reviews.text: I made a simple syrup using this sweetener and I feel like monk fruit is just a front to make you think its a natural sweetener. Its just erythritol. The taste wasn't too bad though it did have a hint of a chemical taste. After having the syrup in a drink my stomach immediately started to hurt. I don't want to chance eating this chemical concoction, so I'm throwing the rest out!
customer_reviews.author: P Fudge

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Swerve granular for quite some time until I purchased Lakanto granular for a particular recipe. I like it much better, mainly because it dissolves in baked goods. Swerve does not. I am keto and it can be difficult to make decent baked goods, but now with Lakanto sweetener the texture is more like actual baked goods. I am sold.
customer_reviews.author: Debra C.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet healthiness
customer_reviews.text: This sugar replacement may cost a little more but my wife has not found out about the replacement because it looks just like sugar and tastes just like sugar but I am able to help to make her eat healthier and she is happy! When my wife is happy, everybody is happy! Good way to end it. Now I am looking for fake bread without white flour then I will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I am on Keto, so most of the sugar substitutes are off limits to me, as is table sugar. However, sometimes you just need something sweet like whipped cream on your coffee. This powdered sweetener is PERFECT. It doesn't have the strange aftertaste that most sugar substitutes have, and is almost a 1:1 sugar replacement. I use it all the time. the only thing you may notice is that when you use a lot of this powdered sweetener, there is a cooling sensation in your mouth. I don't find it unpleasant though, so it doesn't bother me. It's also a really good price lb for lb.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Has some side effects
customer_reviews.text: I thought it is time to go off the sugar - the last from the list of the processed food that I am eliminating from my meals. Friend recommended to me this Sugar Substitute and I decided to give it a try as the Stevia didn't work for me. The taste is definitely better, than other sugar alternatives, but I faced another problem. First, I didn't connect is to this food, but after the research and try-outs it is definitely the sugar substitute that causes the problem. Stomach cramps and bloating (painful and loud). At the end it is still the same processed food, as sugar and even has the same calorie value.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.

customer_reviews.title: Artificial Sweetener Snob Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for "the best" artificial sweetener for as long as I can remember. My simple criteria, that it brings a sweetness with NO aftertaste. Everything I've tried in the past has failed at that, even the "In the Raw" version that has Monkfruit combined with other fake sweeteners. FINALLY, someone has got it right. Lakanto nailed it! Not only is it sweeter than real sugar, I found it had no noticable after taste. My coffee was perfect. While the cost is my only complaint, it is somewhat a wash as you actually use less to get the same sugar result. My quest is over...thanks Lakanto.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Beaudette

customer_reviews.title: my go-to sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I have high blood sugar due to a thyroid condition and I also have some gut issues so some sweeteners really irritate my gut. This version doesn't irrirate my gut and I find the golden variety actually gives a little more body to my gluten free bread recipe. It's a great sub for brown sugar. No added prebiotics so no gas and/or bloating! I do add some additional English Toffee flavored stevia to dessert recipes to boost the sweetnes since it's not quite as sweet as sugar, but experiement for yourself to see what works in your recipes. I love the 3-pound bag too.
customer_reviews.author: cherrytomatopie

customer_reviews.title: Clumpy
customer_reviews.text: Got this based on the recommendation of a fitness guy I follow on Youtube. It was pretty pricey for just a little bit of sweetener, it didn't last long at all. Plus it was kind of clumpy inside, like it was old. The zip closure doesn't zip shut and it fell over on my counter and I had to salvage what I could and put it back in the bag. I think I'll just stick with my sweetener that I can find in the grocery store. As far as taste, this had kind of a weird aftertaste, that other monkfruit sweeteners that I've tried didn't have. Overall not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: My favorite all purpose sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I love this sweetener, and never feel the crash after eating it like I always do with sugar. I use it exactly as I would sugar in baking and sweetening just about anything. I've used it to make homemade ice cream and everyone raves about the ice cream -- it's delicious! I've also used it in baked goods. And I am very impressed with this company. I placed an order for the classic white, but received the golden thru Amazon Fulfillment. When the company read my review stating the error, they immediately emailed that a bag of classic white was on the way. Can't beat that for customer service!
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the taste
customer_reviews.text: Very sweet and not artificial taste. Use half amount for taste of sugar. I yried stevia and it had an aftertaste. This is keto safe. Im on my second bag. Lasts pretty long as u dont need as much. Its pretty expensive compared to sugar but im sticking with it. I used it to can zuke relish and it tastes really good and used half amount. Im going to try it to make grape jelly when my grapes ripen. Hope it works for that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frothy Coffee? Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Covid-19 leaves me bored. So here comes YouTube sending kitten videos. It wasn't long before they sent me this video on frothy coffee. Apparently its a popular drink in Korea. 3 ingredients equal parts instant coffee, sugar, and water. You combine everything then whip it like it calls you Mistress! Damn you Covid! Ahem. I hopde it would work with Lakanto Monkfruit Sweetener. It did! It came out a think pudding like consistency. Went well with almond milk and a few cubes of ice. Will do this again!
customer_reviews.author: LadySin

customer_reviews.title: Very good sugar substitute
customer_reviews.text: I use sugar in my daily coffee and was seeking a reasonable substitute. I wouldn't say that in terms of taste that it is a true 1:1 substitute. But it's close enough. I like being able to cut my sugar intake where I can. It seems like almost everything has some sugar in it. The cost is high but because I only use it for my coffee it lasts a long time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nice flavor. Very sweet!
customer_reviews.text: This dissolves well and has a pleasant flavor. But holy cow, is this stuff super sweet! Yeah, I know. Sweetener is supposed to be sweet. I make homemade chocolate edibles, and I’ve been using a tablespoon of a powdered ethrytol/stevia blend in that recipe along with a very generous amount of cocoa powder. The edibles are dark and bittersweet just like we prefer them. But a tablespoon of this sweetener made them SUPER sweet. I cannot imagine this is a one for one replacement but it does dissolve pretty well. All in all it’s a good sweetener, I just need to use about half the amount. That makes it much more cost effective. 😊
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: A good sweetener!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a few sweeteners, and this is now my go-to kind. The golden tastes very similar to brown sugar, and in MY opinion doesn’t have much of an aftertaste at all! I’ve made fat bombs with it, Cheesecake, cookies, and they’ve all turned out great! I still try to use this even when I’m not doing zero sugar! The only reason for 4 stars is because I wish there were no sugar alcohols in it. If there weren’t, it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Winona Syreini

customer_reviews.title: Has erythritol in it !
customer_reviews.text: The taste is fine, did not detect an after taste. However, several hours after using had the worse upset stomach and diarrhea. took two more uses in my coffee before I read the ingredients. It was the erythritol it contained. in reading the reviews before purchasing, I didn't grasp that it that ingredient. (My fault). some people don;t react to erythritol, but my system can't tolerate it. Other than that, i'm sure it would be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara E. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Healthier, but still not sugar.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if some of the other reviews were paid or what, but I do not believe the taste is similar to real sugar. I still get that menthol/mint aftertaste while drinking my coffee. I don't deny the health benefits of using this over real sugar, but don't be fooled into thinking it will be an easy transition. My wife is hoping to use this in cooking and baking, so we'll see if it tastes better than in coffee. Maybe I need time to adjust to the new flavor, but the aftertaste reminds me of the other alternatives that I've tried. ++Again, I am only criticizing the taste, not the actual health benefits.++
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Great low-glycemic, natural sugar substitute
customer_reviews.text: At the advice of my friend the health and fitness devotee, I tried this. It's a great substitute, tastes nearly like sugar, with no aftertaste, and it's a 1:1 ratio, so there's no formula to remember when measuring. It doesn't taste as good as erythritol (Truvia), but it's minimally processed from fruit, without the high calorie and glycemic effect, and it certainly tastes better than stevia. Although it's pricier than erythritol, I prefer it as it doesn't feed the stupid candida I've cultivated over a lifetime of sugar addiction!
customer_reviews.author: heartstrove

customer_reviews.title: The best sweetener for a keto diet
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this sweetener for about a year now, and of the low-carb natural sweetener options, this is the least likely to cause any kind of GI problems, plus it tastes great. The only way my husband (prediabetic) will stick with a low-carb diet is if we have sweets of some kind around, so I make cookies with this sweetener every week and he eats a few every day. He loves them, and his HbA1C has been gradually dropping. This is a great product and I'll keep buying from this seller. The larger bag offered here is a much better value than the small bags I've gotten elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: photogirltr6

customer_reviews.title: Finally a sweetener that tastes like sugar without raising your blood sugar!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a sweetener that does not raise your blood sugar!! Sweetens like sugar cane and No bitter aftertaste!! It’s a plant based sugar , so it does not have the adverse health effects like Splenda and Sweet and low. To give you an idea about how long a bag last ,(1 tsp of monkfruit sweetener is equal in sweetness to 1 tsp sugar cane) , I drink 1 to 2 cups of coffee and I like my coffee sweet, a bag of Monkfruit sweetener lasted me 3 months just using it for my coffee and making a pitcher of homemade lemonade . I hope this review helps those of you looking for a healthier alternative to sugar cane
customer_reviews.author: joan graft

customer_reviews.title: Horrible after taste
customer_reviews.text: Bought Lakanto munkfruit powder sugar and the white baking sugar. It made beautiful frosting and brownies. I am a very experienced baker and this was the first batch of brownies I had to toss in the garbage since I was a child. The sugar was still crunchy in the cooked brownies. Both the brownies and chocolate cheese frosting, you could taste the wonderful flavor of the brownies and frosting and then our mouths and throat began to sting and burn from the sugar. Thankfully outside of a very sore throat for a few days and headache there was no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

product_meta.title: Lakanto Monkfruit Sweetener, 1:1 Sugar Substitute, Keto, Non-GMO (Golden - 1 Pound)
feature_bullets: Contains zero net carbs, zero calories, and is zero-glycemic; Perfect for cookies, coffee, desserts, and other sweet, sugar-free treats
Matches the sweetness of sugar; A healthy cup-for-cup alternative to ordinary sugar
Works with ketogenic, diabetic, candida, paleo, vegan, low-carb, low-sugar, non-GMO, and all-natural diets
Raw cane sugar substitute (rich, mapley taste like brown sugar)
A mix of monk fruit extract and erythritol with no fiber, no maltodextrin, and no artificial flavoring or sweeteners

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
